messages.message: @Ashish just watched the video. The common pattern seems to be the /repo endpoint. The repo list and the file picker both use it, but the react file system that we use everywhere else does not.
I don't know what that means though if you're sure it's not a backend problem... maybe we're returning something unexpected that the frontend isn't handling correctly?

In the video, starting from 4:25 until 7:30, you will observe when a request is made from File Picker, it gets into a stalled status in the browser. A stalled status indicates that a request has not reached Instabase backend yet. We don't know why the request is stalled. You will observe that the request is stalled for a few minutes. The moment it comes out of stalled status, the entire request gets processed quickly. More about stalled status: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/29206067/understanding-chrome-network-log-stalled-state

It’s definitely limited just to the /repo endpoint though, right? I guess it’s hard to tell in the video because you never see the details of the requests, but if you check out prod you should see that’s the case
I don't recall from troubleshooting. We can find out about the endpoint on Tuesday. But it should really be same as what we have on instabase.com (http://instabase.com).
We can get on a call with them on Tuesday to investigate further.
